refnamediv.refpurpose: Initialise a symbolic description of second order PDE.

listitem.para: variable must be P1 variable (p1_2d or p1_3d)
string - Literal symbolic PDE in the domain
string - Literal symbolic boundary condition on the boundary [BdryName]

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: By default pde returns simple Laplacian equation with homogeneous Dirichlet boundary condition.

refsection.title: Examples
refsection.programlisting: th=square2d(20,20) // square mesh with cardinals boundaries "W", "E", "N" and "S" u=p1(th) mypb=pde(u) mypb.Id='my problem' mypb.eq='-Laplace(u)=x+y' mypb.E='Dn(u)=sin(x+y)' mypb.S='Dn(u)+3*Id(u)=1' mypb.N='Id(u)=x' assemble(mypb) lsolve(mypb)

refsection.title: Allowed Syntaxe
refsection.para:
On the boundary : mypb.[BdryName]="First_Member=Second_Member"
First_Member
Allowed expression is a combination of "Dn" natural flux of the divergence form of the equation on the domain and "Id" the identity, example "Dn(u)+3*Id(u)" (Robin condition), "Id(u)" (Dirichlet condition) or "Dn(u)" (Neumann condition) Second_Member
Symbolique expression of variable living on the boundary combining with cartesians coordinate variables ("x", "y" and in 3d "z") example "u.S+x^2+sin(y)" where u is a variable defining on the mesh
